meanings.definition: A comprehensive description or explanation of an idea or theory.
meanings.sent1: During the science class, the teacher gave an exposition on how photosynthesis works.
meanings.sent2: The museum's exposition on ancient civilizations was very informative.
meanings.sent3: At the history museum, the exposition about dinosaurs made the kids giggle.
meanings.sent4: Her detailed exposition on the topic shed light on many unanswered questions.
meanings.sent5: The book's exposition on space travel was so vivid, it felt like I was there.

meanings.sent1: The art gallery hosted an exposition of local artists' work.
meanings.sent2: The annual car exposition attracted car enthusiasts from all over the country.
meanings.sent3: The funny clown at the circus made the exposition even more entertaining.
meanings.sent4: The fashion designer's exposition of her latest collection was a feast for the eyes.
meanings.sent5: Visiting the flower exposition in the park was a colorful experience for everyone.

meanings.definition: The act of setting forth or explaining.
meanings.sent1: In his speech, the politician's exposition of his plans for the city was well-received.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's exposition of the math problem helped the students understand it better.
meanings.sent3: During the play, the character's exposition of his evil plan made the audience gasp.
meanings.sent4: The detective's exposition of the crime scene revealed crucial evidence.
meanings.sent5: The chef's exposition of the recipe steps made cooking seem easy.
